messages.message:
Hey all!

I wanted to extend an invite to everyone to join the core-services team for a session on the “Art of Troubleshooting” hosted by @Xi Cheng. Xi has built up quite a collection of tools for debugging all sorts of infra issues, from performance to scalability issues, in ours environments and in some of our favourite customer environments. He has a bunch of helpful tips for what tools to use and when, what to make of the results, and also a few case studies for some of the most memorable issues he’s root caused.

I’ve scheduled it for Wed Mar 16 at 9:30am PST. Zoom link (https://instabase.zoom.us/j/95576158208?pwd=b2ZILzlic2FLd0NtcEQ0QkgvR1h6UT09) is here for anyone interested. Can definitely invite more folks to the event directly as well!
This is super awesome! Is there a cal invite for this?
Hi Wilson, I don't know how to past invite link but just added you to the event calendar :+1:
yup, i’m trying to put more google groups on it, but struggling a bit with permissions. working on it

@shaunak I might need you to help add technical-infra@ it won’t let me:
```You do not have permission to see the members of this group.

To automatically add this event to members' calendars, you first have to request access from the group's owner.

Otherwise, members will receive an email invitation but will have to add the event manually to their calendar. You won't be able to see invitation responses, and the event won't keep up with group membership changes.```
I think your group settings might be a bit too private? I’m going to open it up a bit, let me if that’s not okay.
yup, that works too. I tried to add core-eng@ and that has a random selection of ~50 engineers.
can you add me to the invite, @Heymian?
yeah added. our groups are a mess… :stuck_out_tongue:
Can we please record this session?
A suggestion for better name for the session -- "The Art & Science of Troubleshooting"
Great @Xi Cheng, Can someone please include <mailto:pre@instabase.com|pre@instabase.com>?
